Sentece: Selegiline dose- and time-dependently inhibited nicotine metabolism by CYP2A6 (K(i) = 15.6 +/- 2.7 muM; k(inact) = 0.34 +/- 0.04 min(-1)), and the inhibition was irreversible in the presence of NADPH, indicating that it is a mechanism-based inhibitor of CYP2A6.

Sentece: Compartmental analysis indicates that the ratio of formation-absorption rate constant for the selegiline to N-desmethylselegiline pathway decreases from 1.57 +/- 1.04 for the first pulse to 0.61 +/- 0.54 for the second pulse of the pulsatile delivery system, suggesting that the upper portion of the GI tract has a greater capacity to convert selegiline to N-desmethylselegiline than the lower GI tract.
Title: Pharmacokinetic evaluation of a selegiline pulsatile oral delivery system.
